data.title: The Basilica of Saint Mary
data.meta_site_name: The Basilica of Saint Mary | A welcoming Catholic community committed to the well-being of the city.

In-person or online

Weekdays | 7:00am & Noon | Saint Joseph Chapel

Saturday, August 17

5:00pm Mass | Mass of Anticipation

Celebrant: Fr. Peter Brandenhoff

Music: organ, cantor

Sunday, August 18 | 20th Sunday in Ordinary Time

7:30am Mass

Celebrant: Fr. Harry Tasto

Music: organ, cantor

9:30am Mass | ASL Interpreted

Celebrant: Fr. Daniel Griffith

Music: organ, cantor

Summer Soloist: David Davis, saxophone

*11:30am Mass Celebrant: Fr. Daniel Griffith

Music: piano, cantor, contemporary ensemble

*5:00pm MassCelebrant: Fr. Joseph Gillespie, OP Music: piano, cantor, contemporary ensemble

*Please note: On Sunday, September 8, the 11:30am Mass will move to 12:00pm. The 5:00pm Mass will move to 5:30pm.

Monday-Friday 9:00am-5:00pm

Faith Formation

Nurturing our Catholic faith

Forming faith and nurturing spiritual growth

We offer a vibrant selection of programs for children, youth and adults, encouraging our parishioners and friends to continually develop, nurture, and live out our faith.

Children’s and Youth Ministry

Intergenerational Faith Formation

Young Adults

Adult Programs

Volunteer Ministries

Serving One Another

Learn about our Volunteer Ministries

Volunteers empower and invigorate every Basilica ministry at all levels.

Greatest Need Opportunities

We have a variety of current volunteer needs including:

Immigrant Support Ministry

Liturgical Ministry

Mentoring - Hennepin Connections, Prisoners or Patients

OCIA sponsors -walk with an adult who is inquiring about becoming Catholic
